description.displayText:
Ana worked for my mother as a caregiver for almost two years. She easily integrated into the well established
team of caregivers and was both liked and valued by every team member responsible for
caring for my mother, which is often difficult to do. She provided kind, compassionate care to my
mother, who could not do anything for herself. My mother immediately liked her and was happy to
have Ana around. That was no easy feat. Ana was attentive, and detail-oriented, always watching for what my mother's needs were, and quick to take care of those needs, sometimes even before my
mother knew she had them. Ana was consistent and complete in her reporting of what occurred on
each shift, which I appreciated. She was also completely trustworthy, prompt, mature beyond her years,
and always willing to cover for other caregivers. Ana's warmth and compassion for my mother, especially at the end of her life, is something I will never
forget. I highly recommend Ana to any family.

description.displayText: Ana is a wonderful and amazing caregiver. My mother-in-law has advanced Alzheimer's and Ana lived with her 24/7 for two years from May 2015 to May 2017. She is a good communicator and I loved that she regularly and easily texted with me. She was always attentive and nice, and my mother-in-law loved her. As my mother-in-law's Alzheimer's progressed, she became very difficult, but Ana has an easy, calming presence and she doesn't get ruffled. I am a nurse practitioner and found that Ana understood things very quickly. She was smart enough to know when to worry about something, and caught a urinary tract infection very early by picking up on tiny clues. I have no hesitation in recommending Ana for a caregiving position.

description.displayText: I live on the West Coast and my mother was living in an independent living building on the East Coast. In December 2018, we realized that mom wasn't independent enough to live alone, so we hired Ana to live with her four days each week. My mother has some dementia and is a terrible sleeper. Ana was always caring, kind, and flexible. She kept in touch with my sister and me in an appropriate way. She didn't ask for input on every detail but kept us informed about what was going on with mom. They became friends and enjoyed being around each other. When I would visit, it was lovely to listen to their conversations. Ana's responsibilities included medication reminders, eye drops, handling the mail, preparing breakfast and lunch (and dinner when mom wasn't up to going to the dining room), laundry, and arranging and accompanying mom to doctor appointments and reporting back to us. When mom would be awake in the night, Ana would get up with her and was always so patient. She is very competent

description.displayText: Ana has worked for us for the past six months, since July 2017, and we are very happy with her. She is punctual, pays attention to her job. Ana has an easy-going and a very caring personality. She has been very responsive and does everything we ask of her in a timely manner. We trust her and my mom has loved her from Day One. Ana helps mom to bathe and dress, cooks meals for her, help with exercise, takes her to doctor's appointments, and reminds her to take her medications. I can recommend her without any reservation.
